intro: Swainsona complanata, commonly known as the flatleaf swainsona, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, flat pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Swainsona complanata is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
